author: Christopher Jobson
title: Mechanical Crustaceans with Clockwork Insides Illustrated by Steeven Salvat | Colossal
text:
Illustration Mechanical Crustaceans with Clockwork Insides Illustrated by Steeven Salvat by Christopher Jobson on February 13, 2017 
French artist Steeven Salvat has long been fascinated by the clarity and exactitude found in old biological studies. His portfolio is brimming with such renderings, usually with a modern twist such as this stunning series of decorative drawings on skateboard decks . For this new series titled Mechanical / Biological [Crustacean Study] , Salvat imagined intricate clockwork mechanisms that might animate the rigid exteriors of crabs, lobsters, and crayfish. The 10-piece collection was drawn entirely with a 0.13mm Rotring technical drawing pen, the process of which he captured in a video below. (via Colossal Submissions ) See related posts on Colossal about clocks , drawing , steampunk . Also on Colossal...
